posts.content:
Hi I am rather new to character building and this is my first attempt at making a build, any advice would be appreciated.

The concept is a Human Paladin defender with high AC to protect allies and ability to buff himself with paladin spells and rely on his divine abilities (might and shield)
The focus is mainly PvE/PvM but the ability to stand ground in PvP would be nice.

Before I begin there are a few self imposed restrictions I need to mention:
  • Character must be human
  • Character must have access to all paladin spells
  • Bastard sword preferred weapon
  • Shield user
  • I will be partying up with a character with high spot and listen.
Arelith changes:
  • Characters must have at least 3 levels in a class before multi-classing.
  • Paladins gain 1 hard wisdom per 7 levels.
  • Bards can be Lawful/Good alignment
  • 2 gifts can be applied to the character (+2 in a stat)
My class idea in a nutshell is Bard(4)/Paladin(16)/CoT(10)

My questions roughly boil down to...
  1. Is [Expertise]/[Improved Expertise] worth it? If not should I take points off INT?
  2. Should I aim to get [Knockdown] or ]Improved Knockdown]?
  3. Is Toughness worth it?
  4. What Epic feats should I pick? I am unsure of [Armour skin], [Epic wep focus] and [Epic Prowess] as opposed to adding more CHA
  5. What Bard spells to take? (Full cantrips/ 3x Level 1 spells/ 2x Level 2 Spells.
  6. Is it worth Losing Bard for Rogue sneak attack?
  7. Am I losing too much in taking exotic weapon feat over a longsword?

And that's the main jist of things. Any advice on my build would be greatly appreciated.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Where do I start...
Paladins are a MAD class and the restricted environment that you play isn't helping but we will try to do the best we can, as always.

Instead of trying to repair your build it is much easier to give you a proposal and then you can tell us if it is to your liking. But first, let me answer some of your questions.

1. Yes, it is worth it but you don't have the feats to take them.
2. Same as above, plus we don't know if it is common for the enemies to have KD immunity or if there are items such as rogue's hood available.
3. No, unless you have feats to spare.
4. AS is mandatory, EWF & EP even more so for any fighting character.
5. Not much that you don't know already, MA, UV & Cat's are the best, buffs mostly since you can't cast in combat any arcane spell that isn't verbal only.
6. Rogue would also give you evasion but I don't know if it is crucial to your character. A couple dice of sneak attack is alright to have but not necessary.
7. Exotic isn't worth it in this build, you have many more crucial feats to take and you don't have the feats for all of them.

Here is a rough prototype for you,

PAL 20/ BRD 4/ FTR 6 (Epic)
PAL 12/ BRD 3/ FTR 5 (Pre-Epic)

STR:  16 +2 (Gift)/ 18
DEX:    8
CON: 12
INT:   10
WIS:  12 +2 (Pal)/ 14
CHA: 16 +2 (Gift) +8 (Levels + Feat)/ 26

Pre-Epic Feats: Weapon Focus, Weapon Specialization, Improved Critical, Blind Fighting, Power Attack, Divine Shield, Divine Might, Extend Spell, Extra Turning, Craft Wands.
Epic Feats: Epic Weapon Focus, Epic Weapon Specialization, Epic Prowess, Armour Skin, Great Charisma I.

HP's: 324
AB: 32/ 27/ 22/ 17
DMG: 1d8 +10/ 17-20 x2
Skills: Discipline: 33 (37), Tumble: 30, Taunt: 33 (41), Perform: 1 (9), Heal: 16 (18)

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Keep in mind that a different build with the same classes is also possible, (Bard 16/ Paladin 6/ Fighter 8).

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
I do like that, better be an organic character rather than a cookie-cutter one.

The damage is from strength (+4) and epic weapon specialization (+6)  total of 10.
Hit points should be 260+24+40= 324.*
AC should be 17 naked then 28 with full combat (non-magical) gear but really 30 with an easy 12 dexterity.

Great cleave is one of the most useless feats out there, we take it only when we go for dev critical and never otherwise.
Even regular cleave while nice is nowhere in the same tier as the rest of the feats in the build.
You can take bastard sword if you like, if you aren't used to wands then take that out and go for exotic weapons instead.
Don't take non-epic feats in epic levels if you can help it.

Edit: *It is a level thirty build so HP's should indeed be 314.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Go with Fighter.

Reasons are simple, COT is best when taken for at least 10 levels and you can utilize his Divine Wrath, otherwise, with only 6 levels you only gain minimal bonuses and Fighter is better. Your saving throws will be very good since in-game and with the aid of your spell buffs you will sit at 38 charisma making them even better (33/26/29 plus attribute bonuses).

COT would be better with your original idea (16/4/10) but then you would lose your extra spell slots.

Hope I helped, although I have no experience on that server apart from what we hear from players in this forum and the occasional reading of their Wiki.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
You edited your post but it's alright, I will answer to what I haven't yet.

You assume that expertise is going to make you a true defender of the realms and it is somewhat true, this is a good feat for "normal" warriors. In your case though, you already have a holy warrior with plate & shield and full tumble and UMD, that alone puts you on par with a good defensive warrior. Let them make use of expertise and lose 5AB in order to gain 5AC, that is NOT your way. Your Paladin with his awesome charisma can raise his AC upwards to 14! points without losing ANYTHING from his AB just by making use of the Divine shield. Now THAT is the Paladin's way! You are not going to use it all the time but you are sure to use it when it matters. You have 17 (23) turn undead uses to fuel those Divine Feats, make good use of them and nothing will be able to hurt you.

So, to recap, expertise is a nice feat to have but nowhere near that important for you. More skills are always nice to have but you already have the most important ones, including "taunt", so I see little value to lower your AB in order to have more of them. And increased saves in a build with Paladin and a buffed 38 charisma...Let's just say that you simply don't need them. You can sacrifice "craft wands" in order to get your bastard sword and then you will have all that you wanted initially and more. Do not drop "extend spell" you need this for Divine Favour which is an awesome buff and one that you will use all the time, it's that good.

Have fun,

Something like (Str 18, Dex 8, Con 12, Int 12, Wis 16, Cha 24) and

Skills: Discipline: 33(37), Ride: 6, Tumble: 30, Taunt: 33(40), Perform: 2(9), UMD: 18(25), Heal: 24(27) is what I would do.
